products.name: Annaprashan Puja
products.description: Annaprashan is the ceremony where the baby is introduced to solid foods preferably Sweet/Milk Rice for the first time. The puja is performed to bestow a very healthy and prosperous life for the baby.

Insights:.text: Baby takes solid food for the first time.
It helps the baby to grow healthy and strong.
Performed on 6th or 7th month on Janma Nakshatra day.
Mantras are chanted for the baby’s well-being.
Kheer or Milk Rice is the main ingredient for the ceremony.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Bhoomi Puja
products.description: Bhoomi Puja is performed for Goddess Bhoomi, Vastu Purush, the deity of directions, and the five elements of nature to remove negative influences or Vastu dosh in the plot or Land.

Insights:.text: To remove the existing ill-effects carried by land.
Positive energy is restored in the land.
Done before starting construction work on any piece of land.
Vastu Puja and Navagraha Puja are involved.
Main Deity: Bhoomi Mata (Mother Earth).

Promise.text: Vedic Patashala certified and experienced priests.
All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Durga Puja
products.description: Durga Mata is a very powerful deity. Performing this Puja protects people from all troubles and sufferings. A person will be blessed with happiness and positivity in life.

Insights:.text: To help flourish in business by removing obstacles.
Also conducted for peace and benefit of employees.
Done during Navratri time or Fridays.
Main deity: Durga Mata

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Engagement Puja
products.description: Engagement is an occasion where there is a formal agreement to get married and families announce the same to society. It is also known as betrothal ceremony, Sagai, Ring ceremony, Nishchitartham, Roka, Chunni, etc.

Insights:.text: Endorsing the commitment towards starting a new family.
It strengthens the relationship between two families.
The date is fixed based on the auspicious alignments of the couple’s horoscope.
The Lagna Patrika is read as a sign of commitment.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Gand Mool Nakshatra Shanti Puja
products.description: Sataisa Puja is performed when the baby is born in Ashvani, Ashlesha, Magha, Revati, Jyestha, and Moola Nakshatras. The child is said to be born in Gand Mool Nakshatras, it is very important to perform Gand mool nakshatra Shanti puja. It is performed for the well-being of the baby and its family members especially Mother, Father, and Mamaji.

Insights:.text: To get rid of the bad effects of Gand moola Nakshatra.
Performed to remove negative effects of Nakshatras.
Also Known as Sataisa Puja.
Performed on the 27th day after the birth of a child.
27 tree leaves and 27 well glasses of water are used.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Ganesh Puja
products.description: Ganesh Puja is performed for Lord Ganapathi who removes all the obstacles and negative energies. This puja bestows a person with victory, brings harmony to the family, and helps to attain success in life.

Insights:.text: To retain health, wealth, and prosperity.
Ganesh is worshiped before doing any Auspicious activity.
Deity Worshiped: Lord Ganesh.
Durva/Doob grass are the key ingredients used.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Graha Shanti Puja
products.description: Graha Shanti Puja is the set of Pujas and rituals that are performed for Navgrahas to remove all the graha dosh of the person and family.

Insights:.text: Performed before moving into a house, whether rented or owned.
Performed by Hindi-speaking North Indian Pandit.
An auspicious date is compatible with Janma Nakshatra of wife/Female family head.
It helps to please the planets and the Gods, and bring good fortune.
Includes Navgraha Jaaps and Havan.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Griha Pravesh
products.description: Griha Pravesh is the set of Pujas and rituals that are performed before a person starts to live in a new house. It is the process of cleansing the new house with Vedic mantras to make it peaceful and to live happily.

Insights:.text: Performed before moving into a house, whether rented or owned.
Performed by Hindi-speaking North Indian Pandit.
An auspicious date is compatible with Janma Nakshatra of House owners.
It helps to please the planets and the Gods, and bring good fortune.
Includes Vastu Shanti, navagraha, and Laksmi Kubera havans.

products.name: Janamdin Puja – Birthday Puja
products.description: Janamdin is one of the most important days in one’s life. Janamdin Puja is done on the date of birth and recommended for everyone for happy long life.

Insights:.text: Performed on Birthdate.
Get Blessings from the lord and elders.
Graha Shanti Puja and havan are performed.
Main Deity: Ganesh, Lakshmi, Navgraha.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Mahalaxmi Puja
products.description: Mahalaxmi Puja is performed for Goddess Laxmi, the consort of Lord Vishnu is a manifestation of wealth, fortune, and prosperity. People who are involved in business or people who are facing financial problems may perform this puja to receive the blessings and grace of Goddess Laxmi and attain high revenues & profitability in business.

Insights:.text: To acquire wealth and prosperity.
Goddess Laxmi is the goddess of wealth, fortune, and prosperity.
Done on Fridays or any other auspicious day based on the Janma Nakshatra.
Deity worshiped: Goddess Laxmi.
Lotus flowers are the main ingredients used.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Mundan(Chadukarna) Ceremony
products.description: Mundan Ceremony is performed for the child, the hairs are shaved to signify freedom from the past and moving into the new life. Chudakarana is done to ensure the baby grows as a healthy and spiritual individual who is free from sins and also to attain the goodness of life.

Insights:.text: Performed in 1st or 3rd year.
Get Blessings from the lord for a healthy life.
First hairs are shaved.
Main Deity: Ganesh, Lakshmi, Navgraha.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Namkaran Puja
products.description: Namkaran Puja is the naming ceremony of a newborn baby. It is performed to formally announce the baby’s name as per the suggestion of starting letter given by panditji based on the Nakshatra of the baby. Namkaran Puja is a ritual of providing Samskaras to the child, which is considered of utmost importance in shaping the character and upbringing of a child.

Insights:.text: Performed to name the newborn baby as per Shastras.
The name should signify sex, fame, wealth, power.
Performed on the 11th day from the day of birth.
Mantras are chanted for the baby’s well-being.
Graha Shanti havan is performed.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: New Vehicle Puja
products.description: Vahan Puja or New Vehicle puja is performed for a new vehicle to help the owner get all the positive benefits of the vehicle and avoid any untimely accidents. This puja is usually performed for removing any Doshas or Drishti associated with the vehicle.

Insights:.text: Performed for Newly purchased vehicle.
Can be performed at Home or Showroom.
Hanuman, Bhairav, Shukra, Shani Pujan.
Removes any Dosh or Dristhi.
Protects the Owner of the vehicle.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Office Opening Puja
products.description: In the New building or Place, many negative dosh and effects exist. By performing Office Opening Puja, blessings of Lord Ganesha and Mata Lakshmi are invoked to negate the power or influence of negative energies and bring in success in the business.

Insights:.text: To remove the existing ill-effects borne by the building or place.
Positive energy is restored in the office.
Done before opening any new office or business.
Ganesh puja, Lakshmi puja, and Navagraha puja are involved.
Main Deity: Ganesha & Lakshmi.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Punsavan Sanskar
products.description: Punsavan sanskar is performed in the third month of pregnancy to attain a healthy and strong child and attain blessings of lord for a smooth pregnancy. Punsavan sanskar also know as Pumsavan is the second sanskaras in the 16 sanskaras.

Insights:.text: Performed when the child is in the mother’s womb.
It ensures the welfare of the child and mother during pregnancy
Performed in the third month of pregnancy
Ganesh puja, Lakshmi puja, and Navagraha puja are involved.
Get blessings from Divine for getting healthy baby.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Rudrabhishek Puja
products.description: Rudrabhishek Puja is a very powerful pooja of Lord Shiv. Lord Ram did Rudrabhishekam in Rameswaram to Shiv lingam to get the blessings of Lord Shiva. This puja helps in having a strong mind, good health, and getting rid of evil effects. Performing this puja is to eliminate and overcome any obstacles that a person might come across in life. Lord Ram did Rudrabhishek in Rameshwaram to invoke Lord Shiva’s blessings before going to war with Ravan.

Insights:.text: Main Deity: Lord Shiva.
Milk, Curd, Panchamrit, water are used.
Done on an auspicious day based on the Janma Nakshatra.
Performed to remove the Negative effects of Nakshatras.
To achieve victory over death.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Satyanarayan Puja
products.description: Satyanarayan Puja is performed to appease Lord Satyanarayan, the most compassionate form of Lord Vishnu. Satya means Truth; Narayana means The highest being. Hence Lord Satyanarayan is considered the epitome of Truth and Justice. The puja is done to offer gratitude to the almighty on the start or successful completion of auspicious events in a person’s life. The puja is also performed to fulfill people’s wishes and desires. The purpose of this puja is to bring friends and family together, encourage unity and harmony to make sure that abundance, prosperity, general happiness, and well-being prevail in the family.

Insights:.text: Main Deity: Satyanarayan Bhagwan.
Main Prasad: Rava Sheera.
Done on Poornima, Ekadashi, Saturday, or any Shub Muhurat.
Performed by Hindi-speaking North Indian Pandit.
To gain success in business or career growth.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Vastu Shanti Puja
products.description: Vastu Shanti puja is performed for Vastu Purush, lord of directions, five elements of nature to remove negative influences, or Vastu dosh of the home or office to have a good and happy life.  A home that is Vastu compliant will radiate Positive energy, reduces the malefic effects of bad Vastu, and help maintain the peace, harmony, and prosperity of the people staying in the home. Vastu Shanti Puja grants mercy in case the construction of the building had caused any harm to any living thing like trees, animals, birds, insects, etc.

Insights:.text: Main Deity: Vastu Purush.
Vastu puja and Navagraha puja are involved.
To remove the existing ill-effects or doshas at home or office.
Positive energy is restored in the home.
To gain success in business or career growth.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Vishwakarma Puja
products.description: Lord Vishwakarma is the chief deity of all architects and craftsmen also known as Devashilpi. This puja is performed to please Lord Vishwakarma and get his blessings for a happy and wealthy life.  Lord Vishwakarma is worshipped by engineers, architects, craftsmen, factory workers, and people in all professions as a mark of reverence to ensure a harmonious and prosperous career.

Insights:.text: Main Deity: Lord Vishwakarma.
Gains involvement in anything he does and can make the best in his field.
Vishwakarma Puja is done to worship all the material realms one utilizes in his/her livelihood.
All the instruments used in our daily life are cleaned and worshipped on this day.
Puja is celebrated a day after Diwali.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Vivah (Marriage)
products.description: Marriage Puja or Wedding Ceremony is one of the most important events in people’s life. It signifies the transitional state from Brahmacharayashram to Grihasthashramam. Performing Vivah puja acts as an invitation to the many Gods and Goddesses by performing various rituals to come and bless the couple. Vivah is a very sacred union. Performing Pooja for Marriage Ceremony acts as an invitation to the many Gods and Goddesses by performing various rituals to come and bless the couple. The Fire acts as the witness or Sakshi to this holy union. The promises made during Vivah Puja are lifelong commitments that the bride and the groom make to each other.

Insights:.text: It's a spiritual blessing and bond between couples.
It strengthens the relationship between the two families.
The date is fixed based on the auspicious alignments of the couple’s horoscope.
Phere, Mangalsutra and Sindurdan are important steps.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.

products.name: Yagnopavit Sanskar
products.description: Yagnopavit Sanskar or Upnayan Sanskar is performed to a boy who enters the age of 8. It makes a person fit to receive instruction in the Vedas and spread divine power throughout the world. Panditji begins this puja with Gauri Ganesh puja, Punyaha Vachan, Maha Sankalpam, Kalash puja, Upnayan. The havan is performed as per the Shastras. A Brahmin is also called a Dwija that means the one who is born twice. A boy is said to be born again when you perform Janeu Sanskar. A sacred thread, called Janeu or Yajnopaveetam is placed around the left shoulder of the boy.

Insights:.text: The boy attains the right to study Vedas through this sanskar.
This allows a Brahman boy to enter into Brahmacharya Avastha.
The three threads stand for Brahma, Vishnu, and Siva.
Done on an auspicious date compatible with Nakshatra of the boy.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.
High-quality Samagri to ensure a pleasant Puja experience.
